comments.body: The work on this is no longer active.
Microsoft why are you guys always behind the ape ball?? come on man it's 2019 -  lol
I don't think they're still developing this, since Edge will switch to the chromium engine soon, which already has support for details/summary
Existence of IE and Edge is nightmare for me as a webmaster. I can see another reason why.

I'm just telling my users to switch to Chrome or Firefox as their browser of choice.  You really need to get your act together with all the resources Microsoft has at their finger tips.  PS Bill G. was very wrong when he stood on stage and said to the world, the internet has no future!  ...but it shows that thinking pattern still exists in this product!
Would love to see this implemented
Still no updates on this after almost a year and a half? Come on guys, all the other major browsers have supported it for quite a while... https://caniuse.com/#search=details
Please implement support for the details tag - it's such an obviously useful feature, and shouldn't require Javascript.
This functionality is desperately needed.  Please deliver ASAP.

Guys? Are you paying attention? Demand is growing for support here. I have to use <div class="details"> and <div class="summary"> which is the equivalent of <span class="bold"> because Edge does support this markup.
It seems you forgot to set the status to "in development" on https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/status/detailssummary/
Every other modern browser has implemented, get a wiggle on people of Edge!

Edge still missing standard elements, IE 11 not even considered.
So sad...
